intro: Diplostephium lavandulifolium, commonly known as lavenderleaf diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of lavender, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
